item.title: By: Sharlet
item.dc:creator: Sharlet
item.description: Tried this recipe and it turned out well. Though the butterscotch filling sank to the bottom and after I baked the cake, the butterscotch layer wasn't as dark as yours. :( Will try to correct that the next time I make it because it tastes really good!! :D
item.content:encoded: Tried this recipe and it turned out well. Though the butterscotch filling sank to the bottom and after I baked the cake, the butterscotch layer wasn’t as dark as yours. üôÅ Will try to correct that the next time I make it because it tastes really good!! üòÄ

item.title: By: Lina
item.dc:creator: Lina
item.description: anita, I love the way you put the pics up step by step.It makes the reader want to get up and do that recipe straight away cause you make it look so easy! this recipe is a keeper! thanks!
item.content:encoded:
anita,
I love the way you put the pics up step by step.It makes the reader want to get up and do that recipe straight away cause you make it look so easy!
this recipe is a keeper!
thanks!

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/butterscotch-surprise-cake/comment-page-1/#comment-3095">Organza</a>.
Hi Organza A moderate oven is usually around 180C non fan-forced or 160C fan forced. It really depends a lot on your oven, as they differ so greatly. Thanks Anita
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Organza.

Hi Organza
A moderate oven is usually around 180C non fan-forced or 160C fan forced. It really depends a lot on your oven, as they differ so greatly.
Thanks
Anita

item.title: By: Organza
item.dc:creator: Organza
item.description:
The cake looks absolutely divine!
I would love to try this recipe but need to know what is moderate oven temperature in centigrade please.
item.content:encoded:
The cake looks absolutely divine!

I would love to try this recipe but need to know what is moderate oven temperature in centigrade please.

item.title: By: Ruth
item.dc:creator: Ruth
item.description: Hello Anita thank you for this recipe. I have 2 daughters living in London and only last week one asked for this recipe, as they were having a cake day at work. When my girls (I have 3) were still at school, I used to make this cake a lot and it was their favourite. I haven't made it for at least 10 years, and would you believe it, when they asked for the recipe, I couldn't find it. The only difference in the one I made, was that I didn't have a ring pan, so made it in an ordinary cake tin. Thanks again and I shall send this to the girls so they can enjoy it once again. regards Ruth
item.content:encoded:
Hello Anita
thank you for this recipe. I have 2 daughters living in London and only last week one asked for this recipe, as they were having a cake day at work. When my girls (I have 3) were still at school, I used to make this cake a lot and it was their favourite. I haven’t made it for at least 10 years, and would you believe it, when they asked for the recipe, I couldn’t find it.
The only difference in the one I made, was that I didn’t have a ring pan, so made it in an ordinary cake tin.
Thanks again and I shall send this to the girls so they can enjoy it once again.
regards
Ruth

item.title: By: Rilsta
item.dc:creator: Rilsta
item.description: I love butterscotch - I must try this! What will happen if I omit the custard powder? Is there a substitute? I would like to try to avoid buying custard powder just to use two tablespoons in this recipe!
item.content:encoded: I love butterscotch – I must try this! What will happen if I omit the custard powder? Is there a substitute? I would like to try to avoid buying custard powder just to use two tablespoons in this recipe!

item.description: Your swirling is so perfect. I could never get it to that level of perfection. The recipe looks delicious, oh yum I want a slice now!
